title: Erasure and Memory
outcome: A fragment of Halden's original code triggers an automated deletion of all BCI and Council records. As city memory is erased, a black market for authentic memories and evidence emerges. Citizens barter stories, physical artifacts, and testimony to reclaim their histories, forcing a new communal reckoning with the truth, and a permanent end to systemic control.

events.description: A silent 'Halden_Final' protocol spreads through the network, deleting all central BCI history and Council records overnight. No authority can halt the process.

Citizens wake up to find that all official records—housing, jobs, criminal justice, social status—have vanished. Uncertainty and confusion reign as people flood into the streets to verify each other's pasts.
Black market memory auctions spring up in city parks and old service centers. People barter physical evidence, family heirlooms, and group testimony in a bid to reclaim their identities.

Neighborhoods establish trusted councils to arbitrate disputes and validate claims using witnesses instead of digital records. The Council, stripped of authority, fades into irrelevance as a new communal model takes root.
